title: Imperial War Museums - North Africa Collection
description: Comprehensive collection of North African Campaign artifacts, photographs, and first-hand accounts from the Imperial War Museums.

title: El Alamein War Museum
description: Museum at the El Alamein battlefield commemorating the decisive battles of 1942 with artifacts from both Allied and Axis forces.

title: National Archives - North African Campaign Records
description: Official U.S. government records, photographs, and documents related to Operation Torch and the Tunisian Campaign.

title: Australian War Memorial - Siege of Tobruk
description: Extensive collection documenting the Australian experience in North Africa, particularly the Siege of Tobruk.

title: The Rommel Papers
author: Erwin Rommel (edited by B.H. Liddell Hart)
description: Rommel's personal diaries and letters, edited by noted military historian Liddell Hart, providing unique insight into his thinking and tactics.

title: African Trilogy: The North African Campaign 1940-43
author: Alan Moorehead
description: First-hand account by Australian war correspondent who covered the entire North African Campaign, originally published as three volumes.

title: Knight's Cross: A Life of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel
author: David Fraser
description: Acclaimed biography of Rommel by a distinguished British general and military historian.

title: Stirling's Men: The Inside History of the SAS in World War II
author: Gavin Mortimer
description: Comprehensive history of the SAS based on extensive interviews with surviving veterans.

title: The Phantom Major: The Story of David Stirling and the SAS Regiment
author: Virginia Cowles
description: Early biography of David Stirling and the founding of the SAS, written with access to original participants.

title: Rommel: The Desert Fox
author: Desmond Young
description: One of the first major biographies of Rommel by a British officer who was captured by the Afrika Korps.

title: BBC History - North Africa
description: Educational content and documentaries about the North African Campaign from the BBC.

title: History of the Second World War
author: B.H. Liddell Hart
description: Comprehensive military history with detailed analysis of the North African Campaign by the renowned strategist.

title: Pendulum of War: The Three Battles of El Alamein
author: Niall Barr
description: Detailed study of the three El Alamein battles and their decisive impact on the war in North Africa.

title: Commonwealth War Graves Commission - North Africa
description: Records and information about Commonwealth casualties and war cemeteries in North Africa, including El Alamein and Tobruk.

title: SAS Regimental Association Archive
description: Regimental archive containing photographs, documents, and records from the early SAS operations in North Africa.

title: German Federal Archives - Afrika Korps Collection
description: German military records, photographs, and documents relating to the Afrika Korps.

title: The Tank Museum - North Africa Gallery
description: Collection of tanks and armored vehicles from the North African Campaign, including vehicles used by both sides.

title: History of the Second World War: The Mediterranean and Middle East
author: I.S.O. Playfair et al.
description: Official British history of the Mediterranean theater in multiple volumes, providing authoritative detail on operations.

title: An Army at Dawn: The War in North Africa, 1942-1943
author: Rick Atkinson
description: Pulitzer Prize-winning history of the American experience in North Africa, focusing on Operation Torch and Tunisia.

title: Wikimedia Commons - North African Campaign
description: Public domain photographs and documents related to the North African Campaign.
